name: V=0 to V>0 Topological Phase Transition
description: Explaining the Electron (V=0) to Muon (V>0) mass gap as a topological phase transition between Torus and Hyperbolic manifolds.

hypothesis.H0: The mass jump from Electron (V=0) to Muon (V>0) does not follow the topological jump predicted by the KSAU formula.
hypothesis.H1: The Electron-Muon mass gap Delta ln(m) is precisely the difference between Torus (V=0) and the Minimal Hyperbolic Volume (V=V_min) as predicted by the TQFT framework.

data_requirements.description: Electron and Muon masses, and topological volume data.

test_method: Phase transition analysis of the KSAU mass formula at the boundary V=0, comparing it to experimental lepton mass ratios.
